metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3572 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in python-pip in the way it handled Unicode separators in git references. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to install a different revision on a repository. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity. This is fixed in python-pip version 21.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip-whl - 20.3.4-4
python3-pip - 20.3.4-4
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> pip < 10, i.e. pip in bionic and older, parses git references differently, requiring a more significant backport

criterions.comment: python-pip package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20.3.4-4').
